channel.title: Some 8th Grade Random Questions
channel.description:
Alright, well i have this sheet that my teacher gave me and he said to complete it tonight, its just random questions that are suppost to help you go back in the reading or something, i dont know.
The problem is, ive been caught up in math ALL day, and will probably not be finished to around 1-ish, so im gonna post the questions here and can you guys help me with them? Im going to be busy till late tonight studying and finishing math homework so i dont have time. Your help is much appretiated.
1. The salesman said, "The dye used in this red rug comes from a very tiny animal. Thousands of animals are necessary to make even a small amount of dye. For that reason the rug is worth much more than the blue or green rugs." Which rug is the most expensive?
2. Second only to tennis, in my opinion, is the game of golf. Both games require more skill of hand and quickness of movement and eye than card games or checkers. Which game do i prefer?
3. The angry rhinocerous came so close that i could hear the huge beast snort. I reached for my automatic rifle, although i well knew that my bullets would have little effect on his tough hide. Terrified, i watched him advance toward me. How did i feel?
4. During the revolutinary war, everyone - young and old, soldiers, farmers, and artisans - all worked arduously for their country. Washington frequently commended especially the patriotism and devotion of the women. They worked as tirelessly as the soldiers on the battlefeilds, but with other implements than firearms. Whom did the Washington praise?
5. For thirty years Mr.Jones lived in a country where the dog team was the sole means of transportation. Because he was accustomed to the sled of travois, when he returned to civilization he found it difficult to refrain from gaping wide-eyed in wonder at automobiles of our modern city streets. What means of transportation seemed peculiar to Mr.Jones
6. Engineers strive to reduce the weight of engines and thereby lessen the pounding of the driving wheels against the iron rails at high speeds. Less pounding means longer wear, both for the locomotives and tracks. The new stream-line trains are usually make from aluminum and are both lighter and easier to pull than the old type steel locomotives. What is the most economical type of locomotive?
7. The committee of judges will give careful attention to every entry submitted. The entrants should type the manuscripts on only one side of paper. Any magazine reader is eligible to compete. The contest is closed to relatives of the judges, or employees of the firm. Who may submit entries to the contest?
I know theyre easy and stupid questions, but i dont have time.
P.S. Sorry for any errors, my sister and i typed this out in like, 5 minutes by just reading and hitting keys. Im here looking for HELP not douchebag replies, if you think im trying to cut corners have my teacher for a day and then youll see.

item.title: Some 8th Grade Random Questions
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:29, topic:359430”][quote author=the bank link=topic=455890.msg3358959#msg3358959 date=1286156737]

[quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=455890.msg3350037#msg3350037 date=1285199277]

u dont do it, then do well on the tests???

Please don’t ever post again. Idiotic post…

It’s how I do it though, and I don’t get bad marks. I just pay attention in class, and skim through my books a few days before the tests. As long as the teachers make slideshows and put them on the internet, it’s piss easy to find out what you need to know and what you can skip.

Not if your grade is composed of 20% homework.
[/quote]What the fuck kind of school/country are you in?

Ditto to you Abraham…

I never did a single homework assignment (short of projects) and made honor-roll in both of my senior years and scored a scholarship…
[/quote]public school, US[/quote]
Same, hence the retarded system.

Read full topic
